newsitem.title: INDIA: Cricket-India to host four-team Independence Cup.
newsitem.headline: Cricket-India to host four-team Independence Cup.

text.p: Hosts India, Pakistan, New Zealand and Sri Lanka will take part in the four-nation Independence Cup 50-overs tournament from May 9-28, Indian cricket officials said on Thursday.
All the matches in the competition to mark the 50th anniversary of India's independence from British rule will be day-night, starting after 3.30 p.m. (1000 GMT) in view of the hot weather in May.

Pakistan agreed to participate but wanted India to reciprocate by playing in a two-nation Jinnah Cup it plans to host later in the year, Jagmohan Dalmiya, chairman of the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) told reporters.
The Independence Cup will be on a league basis initially, with the top two teams qualifying for the best-of-three final, Dalmiya said.
After a first final at Mohali near Chandigarh, a second one will be played at Calcutta. If the finalists win one match each, a decisive third tie would be held in Calcutta.

The first match of the tournament would be played on May 9 in Delhi, if local cricket authorities agree by February 28 to make arrangements for a standard pitch with proper covers in Delhi's floodlit Jawaharlal Nehru Stadium, Dalmiya said.
If there is no such assurance, the venue would be shifted to Cochin, he said.

Delhi's main cricket stadium at Feroze Shah Kotla does not have floodlights, but local authorities wanted to hold a match in the Indian capital because of sentiments associated with Independence, Dalmiya said.
India achieved independence from British rule on August 15, 1947, one day after Pakistan was formed under the leadership of Mohammed Ali Jinnah.
May 9 Pakistan v New Zealand, Delhi or Cochin.
May 13 Pakistan v Sri Lanka, Gwalior.
May 14 India v New Zealand, Bangalore.
May 17 India v Sri Lanka, Bombay.
May 20 Sri Lanka v New Zealand, Hyderabad.
